Interface_name: HTTP Server - side by using Flask in python
Instruction:
Task Description: Create a Flask-based API for domain name permutation and scanning using dnstwist library, with session management and various output formats.

Class Description: DNSTwistAPI is a Flask application that provides RESTful endpoints for generating domain permutations, scanning for registered domains, and returning results in multiple formats. It manages concurrent scan sessions with cleanup functionality.

Attributes:

app: [Flask] - The Flask application instance
sessions: [list] - List of active scan sessions

Methods:

__init__: [Name]() -> [None] - Initializes the Flask app, sets up routes, and starts the session janitor thread
_setup_routes: [Name]() -> [None] - Configures all API endpoints and their handlers
_start_janitor: [Name]() -> [None] - Starts the background thread for cleaning up expired sessions
janitor: [Name](sessions) -> [None] - Background thread that cleans up completed or expired sessions
root: [Name]() -> [Response] - Serves the web application's main page
api_scan: [Name]() -> [tuple(Response, int)] - Creates a new scan session and starts domain permutation
api_status: [Name](sid) -> [Response] - Returns the status of a specific scan session
api_domains: [Name](sid) -> [Response] - Returns registered domains from a scan session
api_csv: [Name](sid) -> [tuple(str, int, dict)] - Returns scan results in CSV format
api_json: [Name](sid) -> [tuple(str, int, dict)] - Returns scan results in JSON format
api_list: [Name](sid) -> [tuple(str, int, dict)] - Returns scan results as plain text list
api_stop: [Name](sid) -> [Response] - Stops a running scan session
run: [Name](host, port) -> [None] - Starts the Flask application server
